org.wildfly.security.auth.provider

Class ServerAuthenticationContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wildfly.security.auth.provider.ServerAuthenticationContext

  • public final class ServerAuthenticationContext
extends Object
    Server-side authentication context.
    Author:
    David M. Lloyd, Darran Lofthouse

    • Method Detail

      • establishRealmIdentity

        public void establishRealmIdentity(String name)
                            throws IllegalStateException
        Establish the realm identity for this authentication by mapping the given name using the security domain configured name rewriting rules and realm mapping.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to map.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a different realm name has already been set for this authentication.

      • establishRealm

        public void establishRealm(String realmName)
                    throws IllegalStateException
        Establish the realm for this authentication.
        Parameters:
        realmName - the realm name
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if a different realm was already set for this authenticator

      • establishRealmIdentity

        public void establishRealmIdentity(Principal principal)
                            throws IllegalStateException
        Establish the realm identity for this authentication based on the supplied Principal.
        Parameters:
        principal - the principal to set
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no realm is established or of an identity with a different principal has already been established.

      • getEstablishedPrincipal

        public Principal getEstablishedPrincipal()
        Get the established principal for this authentication.
        Returns:
        the established principal, or null if no principal was established yet

      • getEstablishedRealmName

        public String getEstablishedRealmName()
        Get the name of the established realm.
        Returns:
        the name of the established realm, or null if no realm was established yet

      • proveAuthentic

        public <P> P proveAuthentic(Verifier<P> verifier)
                 throws AuthenticationException
        Prove authenticity based on evidence which is delivered to the identity store for verification. The proof of verification is returned. If the mechanism does not support any proof, such as simple password verification, then the proof type should be Void and the result will always be null. Otherwise, if proof is expected but null is returned, the authentication should be rejected.
        Type Parameters:
        P - the type of proof
        Parameters:
        verifier - the verifier of the evidence
        Returns:
        the proof of verification, or null if no such proof is available
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - if verification failed
        IllegalStateException - if the realm name and/or principal has not been established

      • getCredentialSupport

        public CredentialSupport getCredentialSupport(Class<?> credentialType)
        Get the level of support for the given credential type. Note that establishing more information (such as realm name or principal) may provide a more definite result.
        Parameters:
        credentialType - the credential type
        Returns:
        the level of credential support
